entry.title: Tests are failing: privacy_budget_browsertest.cc(717): Value of: settings->ShouldSampleSurface(kBlockedSurface)\n Actual: true\nExpected: false
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): privacy_budget_browsertest.cc(717): Value of: settings->ShouldSampleSurface(kBlockedSurface)\n Actual: true\nExpected: false
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PrivacyBudgetAssignedBlockSamplingConfigTest.LoadsSettingsFromFieldTrialParameters
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/9ca7130c53e609ffcd2699933642a973
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Allow `DOM.resolveNode` to accept an execution context's unique ID
entry.content: The execution context ID specified in Runtime.contextCreated and Runtime.contextDestroyed is deprecated, so methods using the non-unique ID should migrate.

entry.title: command-line tools
entry.content: the link provided in the command line tools section which goes to below address does not work and gives 404 http error https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-11076708_latest.zip

entry.title: Command buffer ANGLEShaderPixelLocalStorageTest failing on Metal
entry.content:
When defaulting ANGLE to Metal, some ANGLEShaderPixelLocalStorageTest subtests start to fail:
`ANGLEShaderPixelLocalStorageTest.DrawAPI` and `ANGLEShaderPixelLocalStorageTest.LoadStoreTokens`: ``` [3212:259:ERROR:gl_utils.cc(420)] [GroupMarkerNotSet(crbug.com/242999)!:C02C330034010000] GL_INVALID_OPERATION: Operation not permitted while pixel local storage is active. [3212:259:ERROR:gl_utils.cc(420)] [GroupMarkerNotSet(crbug.com/242999)!:C02C330034010000] GL_INVALID_OPERATION: Operation not permitted while pixel local storage is active. ../../gpu/command_buffer/tests/gl_angle_shader_pixel_local_storage_unittest.cc:203: Failure Expected equality of these values: GLES2GetError() Which is: 1282 static_cast<GLenum>(0) Which is: 0 ```
The failures can be triggered locally by passing `--use-angle=metal` when running `gl_tests` or applying [this patch](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5310540). The tests appear to fail on Intel Macs only.
Looking at the conditions for when `GL_ANGLE_shader_pixel_local_storage` is exposed, I don't think that it was previously being enabled or tested on these Macs.

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Request for Feedback (side-panel-sizing)
entry.content:
*Instructions:*
*1) Choose if this is a general question about the project (if so choose template 1) or if this is a request for a review of a proposal (if so choose template 2 below)*
*2) Fill in the template completely and delete the instructions and the unused template*
*3) Update the title to reflect your question or "proposal submission for <your name>"*
*4) Submit and wait for the mentors to provide feedback*.
*--------------- Template 1 ------------------*
**Question about Project** Hello, I'm trying to see the bugs in Side Panel Sizing in Chromium, but I can't because I should login first. What should I do?
*--------------- Template 2 ------------------*
**Request For Project Proposal Review**
Please use our [template for a proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IOj4hSdPl8h1-8zYK_Gt3OxA0R44SLbmr-ZH3f9yDXM/edit?usp=sharing)
But we also encourage you to read GSoC's [writing a proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/writing-a-proposal) and [example proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/proposal-example-1). We suggest you reach out early engage with the starter bug of your project, and submit a proposal soon after you have a handle on the problem.
* Link to Google doc that contains your proposal: * Desired Project length (if different from project slide's suggestions): * Desired Project size (if different from project slide's suggestions): *Small/Medium/Large* * Any additional comments:

entry.title: ChatGPT
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem? When modifying text within a document the languages consistently changes without notice.
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Error 500 when trying to install Chromedriver v122.0.6261.57 dependency on a NodeJS project with npm
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Install chromedriver 122.0.6261.57 dependency on a NodeJS project 2. 3. # Problem Description When installing dependencies on a NodeJS project with npm, we get a 500 error code from the source https://edgedl.me.gvt1.com/edgedl/chrome/chrome-for-testing/122.0.6261.57/mac-x64/chromedriver-mac-x64.zip npm ERR! Downloading from file: https://edgedl.me.gvt1.com/edgedl/chrome/chrome-for-testing/122.0.6261.57/mac-x64/chromedriver-mac-x64.zip npm ERR! Error status code: 500 npm ERR! npm ERR! npm ERR! npm ERR! npm ERR! npm ERR! Error 500 (Internal Server Error)!!1 npm ERR! npm ERR! npm ERR!

500. That’s an error. npm ERR!

That’s all we know. npm ERR! npm ERR! ChromeDriver installation failed Error: Error with http(s) request: AxiosError: Request failed with status code 500 # Additional Comments https://edgedl.me.gvt1.com/edgedl/chrome/chrome-for-testing/122.0.6261.57/mac-x64/chromedriver-mac-x64.zip # Summary Error 500 when trying to install Chromedriver v122.0.6261.57 dependency on a NodeJS project with npm # Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know #### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem # Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: When using the fullscreen API, if a new Speculation Rules script is added, the screen goes black.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. On MacOS/Chrome, navigate to https://drab.robino.dev/docs/fullscreen/ 2. Select the "fullscreen" button to activate the fullscreen API 3. Hover over a link in the navigation bar to add the script to the page.
# Problem Description Screen goes black when in fullscreen and adding a speculation rules script to the page.
# Additional Comments Speculation rules not currently supported in other browsers.
# Summary When using the fullscreen API, if a new Speculation Rules script is added, the screen goes black.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Add DevTools support for simulating a pressure state
entry.content:
This was brought up while the shipping the API was being reviewed in https://chromestatus.com/feature/5597608644968448: it would be good to enable developers to simulate a given pressure state to help them debug and test their code.
Having support for this in DevTools is the easiest course of action; bonus points for adding one or more WebDriver endpoints that build on top of DevTools so people can also simulate pressure states programatically.

entry.title: Log some multi IDP metrics
entry.content:
We would like to log some metrics specific to multi IDP in preparation for OT. In particular we want to log:
a) When mismatch occurs, as well as number of IDPs that mismatch. b) Number of IDPs requested.
Reviewing a bit some of the existing metrics will also be useful.

entry.title: Peek dismissal is logged when peek is auto-dismissed on page change
Make Docking Promo inactive days thresholds finchable
entry.content:
The Docking Promo display trigger criteria depends on two thresholds when determining whether or not to display the promo:
1. For users no older than 2 days, whether or not they were inactive in the last 24hr. 2. For users no older than 14 days, whether or not they were inactive in the last 72hr.
To ease experimentation, the 24hr/72hr thresholds should be controlled via server-side Finch to ease testing by introducing potentially shorter threshold times, if needed.

entry.title: Use base::ToVector<> / base::ToList<>
entry.content: There are multiple places in Chrome that define their own one-off conversion functions from any range to either std::vector<> or base::Value::List, often accompanied by a projection. These can be replaced by base::ToVector<> and base::ToList<>.

entry.title: Open external links in Profile 1 (not in the most recent profile)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Have 2 Chrome profile 2. Have both profiles open. Say profile 1 has work-internal.com opened and profile 2 has facebook.com open 3. Have Profile 2 be the one in the foreground (i.e, you are reading facebook) 4. you get a link on slack from a coworker and click on it. The link opens in Profile 2 (the most recent one), next to cnn.com
# Problem Description In Chrome, I have a work profile and a personal profile. I have both opened at the same time.
Problem: While reading my personal facebook, I get a link on a work slack channel. I click on the link and it opens in my personal Chrome profile, because that was the “active’ profile, i.e. the last opened one. Since I am not logged into my work SSO, I am asked to login, which I sometimes do by mistake; i.e. I login into the work SSO in my personal Chrome profile. Which is something I never want to do, since I may allow my personal Chrome password manager to save my corporate password, cache work document, save bookmarks, etc.
Feature request: Have a Chrome setting where I can say “open all external links in profile 1”.
# Summary Open external links in Profile 1 (not in the most recent profile)
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: EventStream tab shows no insights into "retry"
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open DevTools on a page that loads an event stream and inspect the EventStream tab for that resource 2. have the EventStream send a valid "retry" field (ASCII digits only) 3. notice how the "retry" field can't be inspected in DevTools
# Problem Description in general I'd like a little more insights into event streams in DevTools
1. reconnection times set via the "retry" field as already described 2. ability to view comments that were sent (perhaps to be able to show/hide them through some toggle button filter) 3. ability to view ignored fields
2 & 3 could be accomplished by exposing the raw stream… I suppose 1 could too but having it in the EventStream tab provides more confidence that it was parsed and handled
# Summary EventStream tab shows no insights into "retry"
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: v8_wasm_compile_fuzzer: Fatal error in Floating control detected in wasm turbofan graph: Node #271:Merge is inside loop
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5993803562811392
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: v8_wasm_compile_fuzzer Job Type: chromeos_libfuzzer_chrome_asan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Fatal error Crash Address: Crash State: Floating control detected in wasm turbofan graph: Node #271:Merge is inside loop v8::internal::compiler::LoopFinder::FindSmallInnermostLoopFromHeader v8::internal::compiler::WasmLoopPeelingPhase::Run
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=chromeos_libfuzzer_chrome_asan&range=1263679:1263719
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5993803562811392
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Fix New Tab button IPH
Regional language translations text are disappear in "ebay.de" page
entry.content:
Chrome Version:124.0.6315.0 (Official Build) dev (64-bit) 64a22dee8d3180a73913a234898779f5d96755bd-refs/branch-heads/6315@{#1}
OS: Linux(Devian)
Steps: 1. Launch chrome and navigate to chrome://settings/languages . 2. Now change language as Telugu in "Translate into this language" under Google Translate section 3. Add "German" language in "Automatic translate these language" 4. Go to URL: "ebay.de" 5. Observe behaviour
Actual Result: Regional language translations text are disappear in "ebay.de" page
Expected Result: All wording should display properly in Regional language for the "ebay.de" page
The feature is implemented from M113.So raising it as Non-Regression issue.
Please find the attached screencast for reference.
Note: 1.Issue is not repro on Windows and Mac 2.Issue is repro on Stable #122.0.6261.64 , Beta #123.0.6312.3 and Dev #123.0.6300.2
Thanks

entry.title: Issue installing google-chrome-stable-122.0.6261.57-1.x86_64 update on Fedora 39
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Run dnf update. google-chrome-stable-122.0.6261.57-1.x86_64 will appear as an available update for the Google Chrome package. 2. Update will fail with following message:
GPG key at https://dl.google.com/linux/linux_signing_key.pub (0x7FAC5991) is already installed GPG key at https://dl.google.com/linux/linux_signing_key.pub (0xD38B4796) is already installed The GPG keys listed for the "google-chrome" repository are already installed but they are not correct for this package. Check that the correct key URLs are configured for this repository.. Failing package is: google-chrome-stable-122.0.6261.57-1.x86_64 GPG Keys are configured as: https://dl.google.com/linux/linux_signing_key.pub
# Problem Description I have Google Chrome stable channel installed for a long time in my Fedora 39 machine. I have installed multiple package updates through this repository configuration. However, in the past few days, I am facing an issue when trying to update to google-chrome-stable-122.0.6261.57-1.x86_64.
# Summary Issue installing google-chrome-stable-122.0.6261.57-1.x86_64 update on Fedora 39
# Additional Data Category: Installation \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem

entry.title: CSSRayInterpolationType uses resolved length in interpolation
entry.content:
CSSRayInterpolationType uses BasicShapeForValue function that resolves the relative units for center coordinates.
It's wrong, as the value of e.g. em units can change alongside the interpolation.
Fix this by using the unresolved length in interpolation.

entry.title: Suggest Password feature doesn't work with shadow DOM password input
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a simple form with a simple web component password input 2. Login to to Chrome and enable password suggestion 3. Focus on the input or right-click for Suggest Password 4. IF Suggest Password omnibox is opened, choose generated password
# Problem Description When using a custom password input with a web component, Chrome doesn't work well with its shadow DOM and does not open the OmniBox nor does it work well when right-clicking and choosing "Suggest Password".
Few scenarios: - OmniBox should open automatically (it does not) - When clicking on "Suggest Password" the suggested password appears inside the input, but doesn't trigger change, nor does it eventually change the input's value, and after blur the input remains empty. - Tested against Stable & Canary - different behaviors occur, with same results.
# Additional Comments A/B Tested with Canary's experiment "Shadow DOM support for Password Manager" - same results.
# Summary Suggest Password feature doesn't work with shadow DOM password input
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: The Ultimate Guide: How to Wash Your Hey Dude Shoes
entry.content:
Hey Dude shoes have become a popular choice for those seeking comfort, style, and durability. Whether you're rocking the Wally, the Wendy, or any other Hey Dude model, keeping them clean is essential for maintaining their quality and extending their lifespan. In this comprehensive guide, we'll walk you through the best practices for washing your Hey Dude shoes to ensure they stay fresh and looking their best.
Understanding Your Hey Dude Shoes: Before diving into the washing process, it's essential to understand the construction of your Hey Dude shoes. Most Hey Dude shoes feature a lightweight design with breathable canvas uppers and a flexible sole. While this construction makes them incredibly comfortable, it also means they require special care when washing to avoid damage.
Read More: https://healthylifehuman.com/how-to-wash-hey-dudes/
Materials Needed:
Mild detergent or shoe cleaner Soft-bristled brush or sponge Water Towel Optional: Washing machine or hand-washing basin Step-by-Step Washing Guide:
Step 1: Remove Dirt and Debris Start by removing any loose dirt or debris from the surface of your Hey Dude shoes. Use a soft-bristled brush or sponge to gently brush away dirt from the canvas uppers and the sole. Be careful not to scrub too hard, as this could damage the material.
Step 2: Prepare the Cleaning Solution Fill a basin or sink with lukewarm water and add a small amount of mild detergent or shoe cleaner. Mix the solution until it creates a soapy mixture. Alternatively, you can use a pre-made shoe cleaning solution according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Step 3: Spot Clean Dip the soft-bristled brush or sponge into the cleaning solution and gently scrub any stains or soiled areas on your Hey Dude shoes. Work in small circular motions, focusing on one section at a time. Take care not to oversaturate the canvas, as excessive moisture can cause damage.
Step 4: Clean the Insoles If your Hey Dude shoes have removable insoles, take them out and wash them separately. Use the same cleaning solution and gentle scrubbing motion to remove dirt and odors from the insoles. Once clean, rinse them thoroughly with water and allow them to air dry.
Step 5: Rinse After spot cleaning, rinse your Hey Dude shoes thoroughly with clean water to remove any remaining soap residue. Ensure all soap suds are completely washed away to prevent any buildup that could damage the material over time.
Step 6: Air Dry Once cleaned and rinsed, gently pat your Hey Dude shoes with a towel to remove excess water. Avoid wringing or twisting the shoes, as this could misshape them. Stuff the shoes with clean, dry towels or newspaper to help them retain their shape as they dry. Place them in a well-ventilated area away from direct heat or sunlight and allow them to air dry completely.
Optional: Machine Washing Some Hey Dude shoes are machine washable, but it's essential to check the care instructions specific to your shoe model before attempting this method. If machine washing is recommended, place your Hey Dude shoes in a mesh laundry bag to protect them during the wash cycle. Use a gentle or delicate cycle with cold water and a mild detergent. Once the cycle is complete, remove the shoes from the laundry bag and allow them to air dry as outlined above.
Conclusion: Properly washing your Hey Dude shoes is key to keeping them looking and feeling great for years to come. By following these simple steps and using gentle cleaning techniques, you can maintain the quality and longevity of your favorite pair. Whether you opt for hand washing or machine washing, always be sure to check the care instructions provided by Hey Dude to ensure you're caring for your shoes correctly. With the right care, your Hey Dude shoes will continue to provide comfort and style for many adventures ahead.

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Question about project length/interest expression (sanitize-safety)
entry.content:
Hello! I am really interested in this project as it is related to my fields of interest and would be a great opportunity to hone my C++ skills contributing to opensource. The problem is that I've seen in the slides that it has a length of 22 weeks, which sadly would be a conflict with my exchange semester for university. Is there any chance it could be converted into a 12 weeks project cutting some parts and focusing on the core functionality? Also, would you recommend any specific Chromebook for testing? Is the product mentioned in the related bug still a valid choice?
Thank you very much for your time!
Emanuele

entry.title: Yes
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Yes 2. Yes 3.
# Problem Description Yes
# Additional Comments Yes
# Summary Yes
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Beta \ Regression: Yes
